snippet: Splaying the bird and roasting it at high heat ensures crunchy, shiny, mahogany skin.
abstract: Melissa Clark A Good Appetite column gives a recipe for splayed roast chicken cooked in an iron skillet with caramelized ramps, garlic and capers. Photo (M)0
lead_paragraph: DOES anyone really need another recipe for roast chicken? Probably not, but I collect them anyway, trying out each permutation with the zeal of the obsessed. Would this one give me crispier skin, a juicer breast or more soft and supple dark meat?

headline.main: A New Breed of Roast Chicken, Cast-Iron Seared
